metadata.Name: Dangerous Speech Detection
metadata.Description: This dataset contains dangerous speech in Arabic from social media.
metadata.Paper Title: Understanding and Detecting Dangerous Speech in Social Media
Affiliations: Qatar Computing Research Institute, Hamad Bin Khalifa University
metadata.Abstract: The proliferation of social media has enabled the rapid spread of dangerous speech, posing a significant threat to individuals and society. This paper presents a comprehensive study of dangerous speech in Arabic social media, focusing on its characteristics, detection, and potential mitigation strategies. We introduce a new dataset of Arabic social media posts annotated for dangerous speech, encompassing various forms of aggression, hate speech, and incitement to violence. We conduct extensive experiments with state-of-the-art machine learning models, demonstrating the challenges and opportunities in automatically detecting dangerous speech in this context. Our findings provide valuable insights into the linguistic patterns and contextual factors associated with dangerous speech, paving the way for the development of more effective detection and prevention mechanisms.
